Package gal4j.chromosome

Class AChromosome<T>

java.lang.Object
gal4j.chromosome.AChromosome<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the genes. This is a generic type parameter that can represent any data type for the genes.
Direct Known Subclasses:
BinaryChromosome, DecimalChromosome, DoubleChromosome, CharChromosome
public abstract class AChromosome<T> extends Object
Abstract class representing a chromosome in the genetic algorithm. A chromosome holds a set of genes and provides methods for gene manipulation, fitness evaluation, and mutation. The class is designed to be extended for specific types of chromosomes with different gene types.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Filip KÅ™enek

  • Constructor Details

    • AChromosome

      public AChromosome()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public abstract void initialize()
      Initializes the chromosome by setting its genes to appropriate values. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define how the genes are initialized.

    • getGenes

      public abstract T[] getGenes()
      Returns an array representing the genes of the chromosome.
      Returns:
      The array of genes.

    • getGenLength

      public abstract int getGenLength()
      Returns the length of the chromosome (i.e., the number of genes).
      Returns:
      The length of the chromosome.

    • getGen

      public abstract T getGen(int position)
      Gets the gene at a specific position in the chromosome.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the gene.
      Returns:
      The gene at the specified position.

    • setGen

      public abstract void setGen(int position, Object gene)
      Sets the gene at a specific position in the chromosome.
      Parameters:
      position - The position where the gene will be set.
      gene - The new gene value to be set at the specified position.

    • clone

      public abstract AChromosome<T> clone()
      Creates a clone of the chromosome, producing a new instance with the same genes.
      Returns:
      A new cloned chromosome.

    • clean

      public abstract void clean()
      Cleans or resets the chromosome, usually by clearing or resetting its genes. This method can be used to prepare the chromosome for a new generation.

    • mutateGen

      public abstract void mutateGen(int mutationPoint)
      Mutates the gene at a specific mutation point, modifying its value.
      Parameters:
      mutationPoint - The position of the gene to mutate.

    • printGenes

      public abstract void printGenes()
      Prints the genes of the chromosome, typically for debugging or visualization purposes.

    • getFitness

      public double getFitness()
      Gets the fitness of the chromosome.
      Returns:
      The fitness value of the chromosome.

    • setFitness

      public void setFitness(double fitness)
      Sets the fitness of the chromosome.
      Parameters:
      fitness - The new fitness value to be set.

    • isParent

      public boolean isParent()
      Checks if the chromosome is a parent.
      Returns:
      True if the chromosome is a parent, otherwise false.

    • setParent

      public void setParent(boolean isParent)
      Sets the parent status of the chromosome.
      Parameters:
      isParent - True if the chromosome is a parent, otherwise false.
